description:
Being able to craft a quick and delicious dessert can be crucial. If you're hosting a dinner party, it's the last thing guests are likely to eat. The dessert can be an ethereal culmination to the evening — or leave folks with a literal bad taste in their mouths. But firing up the oven to bake a cake, pie, or other pastry isn't always feasible, especially if you're making the rest of the meal, too. That's why we're focusing on no-bake desserts, recipes like mousses, and puddings — and especially homemade whipped cream — which are easy to learn, and can really make the dessert portion of a meal great.

Want more? Check out the full lesson post: https://www.thekitchn.com/homemade-desserts-22954306
name: A Crash Course in Dessert | Cooking School
